final_answer.precision_note: Given data are 3 s.f.; concentration reported to 3 s.f. (0.0200 mol dm-3).

method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2. The initial acid has c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3 and volume V1 = 25.0 cm3, diluted to V2 = 250.0 cm3. Rearrange to c2 = c1 × (V1/V2). Using the same volume units in the ratio (cm3 cancels): c2 = 0.200 × (25.0/250.0) = 0.200 × 0.100 = 0.0200 mol dm-3. The limiting significant figures come from 0.200 and 25.0 (3 s.f.), so report 0.0200 mol dm-3 (3 s.f.).
checks: 10× dilution (25.0 to 250.0 cm3) should make concentration 10× smaller.
